com.wit.and.widget.adapter

Class SelectionModule<Item extends SelectableItem,Adapter extends BaseAdapter>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wit.and.widget.adapter.AdapterModule<Adapter>
      • com.wit.and.widget.adapter.SelectionModule<Item,Adapter>
  • Type Parameters:
    Item - The select-able item type.
    Adapter - Type of the adapter for which is this module created.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultSelectionModule

    public abstract class SelectionModule<Item extends SelectableItem,Adapter extends BaseAdapter>
extends AdapterModule<Adapter>

    public abstract class

    SelectionModule

    extends AdapterModule

    Class Overview

    Selection manager for the IMultiAdapter.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Method Detail

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected(int position)

        public boolean isSelected(int position)

        Checks if the item at the given position is currently selected.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the item in the adapter.
        Returns:
        True if the item is selected, false otherwise.

      • toggleItemSelectedState

        public void toggleItemSelectedState(int position)

        public void toggleItemSelectedState(int position)

        Resolves the select-able item selected state. If the item is selected the flag will be set to false otherwise to true.

        Note that this also notify the adapter that the data set was changed.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the select-able item in the adapter.

      • getSelectedItems

        public android.util.SparseIntArray getSelectedItems()

        public SparseIntArray getSelectedItems()

        Returns the sparse array with currently selected items positions.

        Returns:
        SparseIntArray with select-able items positions which are in this time selected. Note that this array is sorted for optimization (from lowest to highest position).

      • getSelectedItem

        public Item getSelectedItem(int position)

        public <I> getSelectedOption(int position)

        Returns the selected item at the given position.

        Returns:
        Item which is in this time selected or null if there is no item selected at the given position.

      • getSelectedPosition

        public int getSelectedPosition()

        public int getSelectedPosition()

        Note, that this supported only in MODE_SINGLE mode.

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        See Also:
        getSelectedPositions()

      • getSelectedPositions

        public int[] getSelectedPositions()

        public int[] getSelectedPositions()

        Returns the array with positions of currently selected items.

        Returns:
        Array with positions of the currently selected items. Note that this isn't necessary sorted array.

      • clearSelection

        public void clearSelection()

        public void clearSelection()

        Sets the selected state to false for all select-able items.

        Note that this also notify the adapter that the data set was changed.

      • contains

        protected final boolean contains(int position)

        protected final boolean contains(int position)

        Returns flag indicating if the selected items array contains at the requested position some selected item.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item.
        Returns:
        True if the array contains that item, false otherwise.

      • add

        protected final void add(int position)

        protected final void add(int position)

        Adds the item with given position into array of selected items.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item from the adapter.

      • get

        protected final Item get(int position)

        protected final I get(int position)

        Returns the select-able item at the requested position. Same as getSelectedItem(int).

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the item.
        Returns:
        Select-able item or null if there is no item at the given position.

      • remove

        protected final void remove(int position)

        protected final void remove(int position)

        Removes the item at the requested position from selected items array.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item to remove.

      • clearSelection

        protected void clearSelection(boolean notify)

        Sets the selected state to false for all select-able items.

        Parameters:
        notify -

      • setItemSelected

        public abstract void setItemSelected(int position,
                   boolean selected)

        public void setItemSelected(int position, boolean selected)

        Sets the given selected state of the select-able item at the given position.

        Note that this implementation should notify the adapter that the data set was changed.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the select-able item in the adapter.
        selected - New selected state.

      • selectAll

        public abstract void selectAll()

        public void selectAll()

        Sets the selected state to true for all select-able items.

        Note that this implementation should notify the adapter that the data set was changed.

      • selectRange

        public abstract void selectRange(int startPosition,
               int count)

        public void selectRange(int startPosition, int count)

        Sets the selected state to true for the select-able items at the positions (startPosition, startPosition + count).

        Note that this implementation should notify the adapter that the data set was changed.

        Parameters:
        startPosition - Position for selection start.
        count - Count of the items to select from the start position.
